intro: Mohria scioana, commonly known as the nightshade of the Andes, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or purple in color. Its leaves are simple and ovate, with a slightly hairy texture. Mohria scioana is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
